insert.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to put something inside or into something else
insert.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: His hand shook slightly as he inserted the key into the lock.
insert.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to add something to the middle of a document or piece of writing
insert.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: His manager inserted a new clause into his contract.
Insert your comments in the space below.
insert.translation[1].definitions[0].def: printed pages that are put inside a newspaper or magazine in order to advertise something
insert.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: a six-page insert on computer software
insert.translation[1].definitions[1].def: something that is designed to be put inside something else
insert.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He wore special inserts in his shoes to make him look taller.
insert.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to put something inside or into something else
insert.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: He inserted a sheet of paper into the printer.
insert.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to add something new to a piece of writing
insert.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: His manager inserted a new clause into his contract.
insert.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a sheet containing information or an advertisement that is put inside a newspaper or magazine
insert.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: This year the company plans to spend $17.9 million on ads, including newspaper inserts.
